intro: Hieracium pulmonaria, commonly known as lungwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive spotted leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are often covered in a dense coating of fine hairs, giving them a woolly appearance. Hieracium pulmonaria is a perennial species that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
